name: Applejack Rabbit
description: The Applejack Rabbit dates to at least the 1930s, and early recipes produced drinks that were teeth-grindingly sweet. This tweak on the recipe comes from one of the more influential books in the mixological canon, David Embury's The Fine Art of Mixing Drinks, which is now back in print after a nearly 50-year absence from the shelves. Combining the fruity depths of applejack with fresh orange and lemon juice and sweetening the mix with the richness of maple, the Applejack Rabbit combines some of the best of the season's flavors.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds; strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of orange peel.
